title: First-Person Perspective Emergency Medical Technician Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental life support skills and emergency equipment operation
context.additional_context: Mobile learning support via QR codes and formative assessment-centered feedback system operation

learning_goals: Learners can identify core symptoms with 85% accuracy using first-person perspective videos during emergency patient assessments.
Learners can perform airway maintenance and CPR procedures in a VR simulation environment with three consecutive successful attempts.
Learners can self-directly learn complex equipment operations within 10 minutes using a QR code-based access system.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
